## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've been hearing a lot about the Verus testnet and I'm curious about its status. What's the current status of the DeFi, ID, and PBaaS cross-chain protocols on the testnet?

**AI Assistant:**
According to the latest updates, there are no known bugs or errors in the DeFi, ID, or PBaaS cross-chain protocols on the testnet. The testnet is running smoothly, and the foundation is encouraging people to test it out and report any issues they might find.

**User:**
That's great to hear! I've also heard that the Verus Coin Foundation is offering some incentives to encourage people to test the protocol. What are they offering to incentivize people to test the protocol and find bugs before mainnet release?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus Coin Foundation is offering a bounty of at least 500 VRSC (and possibly more for security-related reports) for the first 10 people who report any actual protocol bug before mainnet release. For a security-related issue, the bounty can be as high as 10,000 VRSC. This is a great opportunity for people to contribute to the development of the protocol and earn some rewards in the process.

**User:**
That sounds like a great way to get people involved. What's the purpose of the testnet, and what is the Verus Coin Foundation encouraging people to do on it?

**AI Assistant:**
The purpose of the testnet is to test the DeFi, ID, and PBaaS cross-chain protocols before mainnet release. The Verus Coin Foundation is encouraging people to try out the incredible capabilities of the protocol on the testnet and look for any potential, remaining issues that can be found before mainnet release. They want people to push the protocol to its limits, test its functionality, and report any bugs or issues they might find. This will help ensure that the mainnet release is as smooth and bug-free as possible.
What is the current status of the DeFi, ID, and PBaaS cross-chain protocols on the testnet?
At this time, there are no known bugs or errors in the DeFi, ID, or PBaaS cross-chain protocols on the testnet.

## Verus PBaaS and DeFi RC5 - BUG BOUNTIES
At this time, we are not aware of any bugs or errors in the DeFi, ID, or PBaaS cross chain protocols on this version of testnet. We do not anticipate any changes to the PBaaS protocol before mainnet release, and we hope you will join us on testnet trying out all of the incredible capabilities and looking for any potential, remaining issues that can possibly be found before mainnet release. While we don’t expect it to be easy to find bugs in the protocol, The Verus Coin Foundation is offering a bounty of at least 500 VRSC (possibly more for security related reports) for the first 10 people who are first to report any actual protocol bug before mainnet release, meaning failure of a properly executed command or API on a functioning VRSCTEST or PBaaS chain to function as intended. If anyone is first to find and describe the exploit for an exploitable security hole in any part of the protocol, the bounty will be a minimum of 1,000 VRSC, and for a serious potential security issue, 10,000 $VRSC.## Emoji IDs and 🎃Chain
In the spirit of this release day, we have taken advantage of VerusIDs and currency emoji support and created a new, merge mineable PBaaS chain, 🎃. It has been said that those who merge mine 🎃chain at midnight will disappear into the crypto-metaverse, never to be seen again, become VerusID avatars, and be forever doomed to being bought and sold on the VRSCTEST marketplace for all eternity (or until the next testnet reset). YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!
